answerText: loss of heterozygosity [prompt on allelic imbalance][10] Loss of heterozygosity is often the origin of this cancer of the light-sensitive tissue at the back of the eye, which is caused by a mutation on chromosome thirteen. It typically manifests itself by the age of five.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | MIT A + LASA B | 14 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The onset of cancer after this event is an example of the Knudson's two-hit hypothesis. For 10 points each: [10] Name this event in which one allele of a gene loses function, leaving a cell with a mutated copy that has the potential to disrupt cellular homeostasis. Tumor suppressor genes often fail to function after this event.
